titlestmt.titleproper: James Rush views of Italy scrapbook undated
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

did.unittitle: James Rush views of Italy scrapbook

bioghist.p: James Rush (1786-1869) was the seventh child of Dr. Benjamin Rush and Julia Stockton. Rush studied at both Princeton University and at the University of Edinburgh. After returning to Philadelphia, he obtained his M.D. from the University of Pennsylvania in 1809. In 1813, Rush was appointed Treasurer of the United States Mint, a post he held until 1830. In 1819 James Rush married Phoebe Anne Ridgway (1799-1857), daughter of the wealthy Philadelphia merchant Jacob Ridgway (1768-1843). He retired from public life after only a short time to peruse his literary and scientific interests. After his death, James Rush left his estate to found the Ridgway Branch of the Library Company of Philadelphia.

scopecontent.p: This is a bound volume of prints from the library of James Rush illustrating various views of European cities and locales including Turin, Lake Como, Budapest, and Berlin. One plate is hand colored.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
